name: TruthTable

values.name: fromExprs
values.comment:
Generate a truth table from a list of expressions.

    import TruthTable
    import TruthTable.Expr exposing (Expr(..))

    -- De Morgan's Law
    TruthTable.fromExprs
        [ Not (Or (Var "P") (Var "Q"))
        , And (Not (Var "P")) (Not (Var "Q"))
        ]

A text preview of the generated table.

```plain
P     Q     (¬P) ∧ (¬Q)     ¬(P ∨ Q)
-------------------------------------
T     T     F               F
T     F     F               F
F     T     F               F
F     F     T               T
```

name: TruthTable.Expr

types.name: Expr
types.comment:
A propositional expression.

    -- ¬P
    Not (Var "P")

    -- ¬P ∨ Q
    Or (Not (Var "P")) (Var "Q")

    -- P ⇒ Q
    Implies (Var "P")  (Var "Q")

values.name: eval
values.comment:
Evaluate an expression with the specified environment.

    And (Var "P") (Var "Q")
        |> eval (Env.make [ "P", "Q" ], [ True, False ])
        == Ok False

values.name: toString
values.comment:
Transform an `Expr` to a `String`

    Var "P" |> Expr.toString
        == "P"

    And (Var "P") (Var "Q") |> Expr.toString
        == "P ∧ Q"

    Or (Not (Var "P")) (Var "Q") |> Expr.toString
        == "¬P ∨ Q"

values.name: vars
values.comment:
Determine the variables used in an expression.

    Xor (And (Var "P") (Var "Q")) (Or (Var "P") (Var "Q"))
        == Set.fromList [ "P", "Q" ]
